heroHeadText: Empowering you to navigate your recruitment process with our innovative solutions. Our platform is designed to simplify every aspect of the recruitment journey, from attracting the best talent to making seamless hiring decisions.

search.title: Advanced Job Search
search.description: Find the best job opportunities tailored to your skills and preferences. Our platform offers powerful search and filtering options.

candidate_screening.title: Candidate Screening
candidate_screening.description: Efficiently review and shortlist candidates using recommendations and automated screening tools.

hiring_process.title: Streamlined Hiring Process
hiring_process.description: Manage job postings, track applications, and simplify your hiring workflow with our intuitive tools.

calendar.title: Calendar with Meetings
calendar.description: Schedule and manage interviews effortlessly with an integrated calendar. No more missed calls or missed meetings!

automated_emails.title: Automated Emails
automated_emails.description: Send task and meeting reminders automatically to candidates, keeping everyone on track.

export_data.title: Export Data to XLSX
export_data.description: Easily export recruitment data, candidate lists, and reports to Excel for further analysis and documentation.

stage_updates.title: Candidate Stage Updates
stage_updates.description: Keep candidates informed about their current recruitment stage with automated updates and notifications.

ai_analysis.title: AI-powered CV & Cover Letter Analysis
ai_analysis.description: Analyze resumes and cover letters with AI to extract key skills and match candidates to job requirements.

scoring_system.title: Automated Scoring System
scoring_system.description: Define what’s important for you, and our system will calculate accurate scores for each candidate based on your criteria.

about_description: Ultimate platform designed to streamline the recruitment process.Our innovative tools help you find, evaluate, and hire top talent with ease.
know_how_description: Discover how to make the most of RecruitHelper. Click on a section to access detailed guides and expert tips.

recruitments.name: Recruitments
recruitments.description: Learn how to create job postings, and optimize your hiring process.

applications.name: Applications
applications.description: Discover how to apply for jobs, and stay updated on your hiring journey.

account.name: Account
account.description: Learn how to set up your profile and manage your account settings.

dashboard.name: Dashboard
dashboard.description: Understand how to navigate your dashboard and access key features.

Recruitments_Desc: Discover the latest job opportunities and recruitment openings. Find the perfect role that fits your skills and experience with our comprehensive hiring platform.
Opinions_Desc: See what users are saying about their experience with our platform. We value your feedback and strive to improve our services based on your suggestions and experiences.
No Opinions available at the moment.
name: Name
subject: Subject
subject_length: Subject must be at least 5 characters long
message_length: Message must be at least 10 characters long
faq_1_answer: RecruitHelper is a service that allows recruiters to create and manage recruitments efficiently while also enabling job seekers to apply for open positions, automate processes, and centralize all recruitment needs in one place.
faq_2_question: What are the benefits of using RecruitHelper?
faq_2_answer: RecruitHelper provides a seamless recruitment experience by offering tools for job postings, candidate tracking, automated CV screening, cover letter analysis, and real-time recruitment insights.
faq_3_question: What is the difference between RecruitHelper and job search engines?
faq_3_answer: Unlike traditional job search engines, RecruitHelper focuses on both recruiters and job seekers by providing an all-in-one recruitment management system, including automation and candidate matching features.
faq_4_answer: Yes, RecruitHelper offers a free version with essential features, while premium options provide advanced functionalities for larger recruitment needs.
faq_5_question: Can I export my recruitment data?
faq_5_answer: Yes, RecruitHelper allows you to export recruitment data in XLSX format for further analysis and record-keeping.
faq_6_question: How do I create an account on RecruitHelper?
faq_6_answer: You can create an account by signing up with your email and setting a password. You may also sign up using Google for convenience.
faq_7_question: Can I track my job applications on RecruitHelper?
faq_7_answer: Yes, RecruitHelper provides a dashboard where you can track your job applications, see their status, and receive updates from recruiters.
faq_8_question: How do I contact RecruitHelper support?
faq_8_answer: You can reach out to our support team via email at recruithelpercontact@gmail.com or use the form on our website.
faq_9_answer: Yes, RecruitHelper provides an integrated interview scheduling tool, allowing recruiters to set up and manage interviews seamlessly.

content.title: Acceptance of Terms and Conditions
content.text: By accessing or using the Service, you are deemed to have accepted these Terms and Conditions. If you do not agree to these Terms and Conditions, you must not access or use the Service.

content.title: Changes to Terms and Conditions
content.text: We reserve the right to update or modify these Terms and Conditions at any time. Your continued use of the Service after the posting of any changes to these Terms and Conditions constitutes your acceptance of those changes.

content.title: Eligibility
content.text: To use the Service, you must be at least 18 years old and have legal capacity to enter into binding agreements according to Polish law.

content.title: Prohibited Uses
content.text: You may not use the Service for any illegal or unauthorized purpose. You may not use the Service to engage in any activity that violates any applicable local, state, national, or international law or regulation, including but not limited to Polish laws.

content.title: Intellectual Property
content.text: The Service and its original content (excluding Content provided by users), features, and functionality are and will remain the exclusive property of RecruitHelper and its licensors. The Service is protected by copyright, trademark, and other laws of both the Republic of Poland and foreign countries. Your access to the Service and Content is subject to these Terms and Conditions.

content.title: Termination
content.text: RecruitHelper reserves the right to terminate your access to the Service at any time, for any reason or no reason at all. Upon termination, your right to use the Service will immediately cease.

content.title: Disclaimer of Warranties
content.text: RecruitHelper does not guarantee that the Service will be error-free or uninterrupted, or that any defects or errors will be corrected. RecruitHelper disclaims all warranties, express or implied, including but not limited to the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement.

content.title: Limitation of Liability
content.text: In no event shall RecruitHelper or its suppliers be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, or consequential damages.

content.title: Indemnification
content.text: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless RecruitHelper and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses.

content.title: Governing Law
content.text: These Terms and Conditions shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Poland, without regard to its conflict of law provisions.

content.title: Entire Agreement
content.text: These Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between you and RecruitHelper with respect to the Service and supersede any prior agreements.

content.title: Contact Us
content.text: If you have any questions or concerns about these Terms and Conditions, please contact us at recruithelpercontact@gmail.com.

ChooseMethod.title: Select a Method to Add Applicants
ChooseMethod.description: Choose how you want to add applicants to the recruitment process. You can manually input their details or use an automated system powered by NLP and AI technologies to extract data from CVs.

manual.title: Add Applicants Manually
manual.description: Input applicant details manually. Suitable for cases where structured CVs are not available or when adding candidates individually.

cv.title: Add Applicants Using CV
cv.description: Upload CVs and let our AI-powered system extract key information using advanced Regex, NLP, and LLM technologies.

UploadCV.progress: Please wait while we extract data from the uploaded CVs. This process can take some time, depending on the number of CVs and the complexity of the data.
UploadCV.redirect: Once completed successfully, you will get redirected to the Add Applicants page where you can add the extracted data and check if the data is correct.

applicantStages.toBeChecked: The applicant is awaiting review, their application has not yet been evaluated.
applicantStages.rejected: The applicant has been rejected because their application did not meet the required qualifications or criteria.
applicantStages.checked: The applicant has been checked, their application has been reviewed for qualifications and fit.
applicantStages.invitedForInterview: The applicant has been invited for an interview to assess their skills and suitability for the team.
applicantStages.interviewed: The applicant has been interviewed, the interview aimed at assessing their experience and skills.
applicantStages.tasks: The applicant has completed tasks assigned during the recruitment process, which are evaluated based on performance.
applicantStages.offered: The applicant has been offered a job, and the offer is ready to be accepted or declined.
applicantStages.hired: The applicant has been hired, and the recruitment process is complete.

description.1: Each weight (Experience, Skills, Education, Courses, Languages) must be between 0 and 100.
description.2: The sum of all weights must be exactly 100.

description.1: Language name must be valid and exist.
description.2: Accepted levels: A1, A2, B1, B2, C1, C2.

description.1: Skills: Optional, should be separated by commas (e.g., JavaScript, React, Node.js).
description.2: Courses: Optional, should also be separated by commas (e.g., Project Management, Agile Methodology).

expertRecommendations.title: Expert Recommendations
expertRecommendations.intro: Based on industry insights, a balanced weight distribution is:
expertRecommendations.note: *These are guidelines—final distribution should align with the recruiter's priorities.

recruitmentChooseMethod.Headertitle: Choosing a Method to Add Applicants

description.1: This method allows you to manually input applicant details, such as name, experience, skills, and education.
description.2: Recommended for cases where structured CVs are not available or require manual adjustments.
description.3: This method leverages AI-powered CV parsing using **Regex, NLP, and LLM models** to extract key details automatically.
description.4: Recommended for handling large applicant volumes efficiently and reducing manual entry time.
description.6: Ensure all applicant details are accurate to maintain high recruitment quality.
description.7: The system will validate data and highlight missing or incorrect fields.

Contact Information.emailDesc: Required, must be a valid format.

Required Documents.cvDesc: Required, must be uploaded. Only PDF files are allowed.

Language Skills.levelDesc: Accepted levels: A1, A2, B1, B2, C1, C2.

Skills & Courses.skillsDesc: Optional, should be separated by commas (e.g., JavaScript, React, Node.js).
Skills & Courses.coursesDesc: Optional, should also be separated by commas (e.g., Project Management, Agile Methodology).

Additional Information.infoDesc: Ensure all applicant details are accurate to maintain high recruitment quality.
Additional Information.infoDesc2: The system will validate data and highlight missing or incorrect fields.

1.4: Each applicant must have a CV file.
1.6: Can be added for additional insights.

2.1: 1. Upload one or multiple CV files (PDF format only).
2.2: 2. Our system will automatically extract key information using AI-powered text analysis.
2.3: 3. You will review the extracted data and fill in any missing details.
2.4: 4. Once verified, save the applicants into the system.

3.1: Double-check all extracted details before saving.
3.2: Add missing information such as education, experience, and skills if needed.
3.5: to finalize and add applicants to the recruitment process.

recruitmentOverview.title: Recruitment Overview Guide
recruitmentOverview.recommendations_desc: We recommend the following steps to follow while recruiting:

steps.1.1: (Optional) Check and score Cover Letters if the applicant has one.
steps.2: Add the "Checked" stage to applicants with the highest scores. Mark the rest as "Rejected".
steps.3: Plan meetings or tasks based on your recruitment needs.
steps.4: Proceed with the scheduled meetings or tasks.
steps.7: Mark candidates to whom you have offered jobs.
steps.8: Mark candidates that have been hired.

finalization.review: Leave a review of the recruitment process.
finalization.close: Click "Close Recruitment" to finish the process.

recruitmentOverview.current_stage_desc: Displays the current progress of the recruitment process and enables switching between stages.
recruitmentOverview.statistics_desc: Displays key metrics like Total Applicants, Highest Score, Average Score, Total Tasks, and Total Meeting Sessions.
recruitmentOverview.cover_letter_desc: Indicates the percentage of applicants who submitted a Cover Letter along with their application.
recruitmentOverview.applicants_stage_desc: Provides a breakdown of applicants at different stages of recruitment.

recruitmentApplicantsStages.title: Guide for Managing Applicant Stages
recruitmentApplicantsStages.tracking_desc:
- Each applicant has an assigned recruitment stage (e.g., Applied, Interview, Hired).   
 - The stage helps in monitoring the applicant's journey through the recruitment process.
recruitmentApplicantsStages.modifying_desc:
- Click on an applicant's stage to update it.   
 - The system provides predefined stages to maintain consistency.   
 - Ensure changes are accurate to keep track of applicant progress.

recruitmentApplicantsManage.title: Guide for Managing Applicants
recruitmentApplicantsManage.viewing_desc:
Displays all information about an applicant, including personal details, experience, skills, and education.
Allows reviewing and verifying extracted data before finalizing the application.
recruitmentApplicantsManage.cv_preview_desc:
If available, users can preview an applicant's CV and Cover Letter directly within the system.
Only PDF files are supported for preview.
recruitmentApplicantsManage.adding_desc:
Clicking the "Add Applicant" button redirects users to the applicant addition method selection.
Users can choose between manual entry or automated CV parsing.

recruitmentTasks.title: Guide for Managing Tasks
recruitmentTasks.explanation_desc:
- Total Points collected from all tasks are equal to 25% of final ranking score. 
 - You can decide to count Task Points or not in Final Ranking section (on default counting is enabled).
recruitmentTasks.overview_desc:
- This section allows you to manage recruitment tasks effectively. 
 - You can view key details like task Name, Description, Deadline Date, Deadline Time, and Points Weight. 
 - Points Weight is determinating ratio of points earned for completing the task in contrast to other tasks. 
 - Deadline Date and Time is the date and time when the task is due to be completed.
recruitmentTasks.actions_desc_1: Modify task details like deadline, description, or points.
recruitmentTasks.actions_desc_2: Permanently remove a task from the system. With this action, all related data (like assinged tasks) will be lost.
recruitmentTasks.actions_desc_3: Add a new task to the recruitment process.

recruitmentTasksPoints.title: Guide for Managing Task Points
recruitmentTasksPoints.viewing_desc:
- Displays users with their assigned tasks and earned points. 
 - Allows modification of assigned task details.
recruitmentTasksPoints.deleting_desc: Remove assigned task from the system.
recruitmentTasksPoints.creating_desc: Assign a task to an applicant.
recruitmentTasksPoints.rules: Rules for Assigning Tasks and Points
recruitmentTasksPoints.rules_desc:
- Applicant can be only assigned to a task only once. 
 - Applicant can be assigned to multiple tasks. 
 - Only Applicants in stages
recruitmentTasksPoints.rules_desc_3:
can be assigned to tasks! 
 - Task can be assigned to only one applicant at a time.
recruitmentTasksPoints.changing_points_desc:
- Users can update task points through an input field. 
 - The changes are validated to ensure accuracy. 
 - Task points must be between 0 and 100.

recruitmentMeetingsSessions.title: Guide for Managing Meeting Sessions
recruitmentMeetingsSessions.explanation_desc:
- Total Points collected from all meetings are equal to 25% of final ranking score. 
 - You can decide to count Meeting Points or not in Final Ranking section (on default counting is enabled).
recruitmentMeetingsSessions.creating_desc:
- Click on the create meeting session button to add a new session. 
 - Provide details such as Name, Description, and Points Weight. 
 - Points Weight is determinating ratio of points earned in one meeting in contrast to other meeting.
recruitmentMeetingsSessions.managing_desc: - Each session displays relevant details such as Name, Description, and Points Weight.
recruitmentMeetingsSessions.editing: Use the Edit button to modify session details.
recruitmentMeetingsSessions.deleting: Click the Delete button to remove a session permanently

recruitmentMeetings.title: Guide for Managing Meetings
recruitmentMeetings.meetingsCalendar_desc:
- Displays a calendar with red dots marking days that have scheduled meetings. 
 - Click on a date to view the list of scheduled meetings for that day.
recruitmentMeetings.meetingsDetails_desc: - Shows the list of meetings scheduled for the selected date.
recruitmentMeetings.meetingsDetails_desc_6: Documents: CV Preview | Cover Letter Preview
recruitmentMeetings.meetingsActions_desc: Join Meeting: Redirects to the meeting session.
recruitmentMeetings.meetingsActions_desc_2: Open CV: Opens the applicant's CV in a new tab.
recruitmentMeetings.meetingsActions_desc_3: Open Cover Letter: Opens the applicant's cover letter in a new tab (if uploaded).

recruitmentMeetingsPoints.title: Guide for Managing Meetings Points
recruitmentMeetingsPoints.explanation_desc:
- Displays users with their assigned meetings and earned points. 
 - Allows modification of assigned meeting details.
recruitmentMeetingsPoints.Edit: Edit Assigned Meeting: Modify assinged meeting or applicant.
recruitmentMeetingsPoints.Delete: Delete Assigned Meeting: Remove assigned meeting from the system.
recruitmentMeetingsPoints.Plan Meeting: Plan Meeting: Assign a meeting to an applicant.
recruitmentMeetingsPoints.Rules for Assigning Meetings and Points: Rules for Assigning Meetings and Points
recruitmentMeetingsPoints.Rules for Assigning Meetings and Points_:
- Applicant can be only assigned to a meeting only once. 
 - Applicant can be assigned to multiple meetings. 
 - Only Applicants in stages

can be assigned to meetings! 
 - Meetings can't be in the same time slot or in past. They must be in the future at least one hour form now. 
 - Assigned meetings points are weighted based on the weight distribution defined in the meeting session settings. 
 - Applicants can earn points based on the assigned meetings. 
 - The system calculates the total points based on the weight distribution and applicant's meetings.
recruitmentMeetingsPoints.Changing Meetings Points_desc:
- Users can update meeting points through an input field. 
 - The changes are validated to ensure accuracy. 
 - Meeting points must be between 0 and 100.

recruitmentCoverLettersAnalysis.title: Guide for Cover Letter Analysis
recruitmentCoverLettersAnalysis.overview_desc:
- This section allows you to review cover letter analysis generated by an intelligent system. 
 - The AI-based tool evaluates cover letters and suggests scores based on relevance, quality, and completeness. 
 - If no analysis is available, you can manually review and rate the cover letter.
recruitmentCoverLettersAnalysis.applicantInformation_desc:
- Each row in the table represents an applicant along with their submitted cover letter. 
 - You can view details such as name, email, and the proposed cover letter points. 
 - If a cover letter has not been analyzed yet, the system will display "No Analysis Yet".

recruitmentCoverLettersPoints.title: Guide for Cover Letter Points
recruitmentCoverLettersPoints.assigning_desc:
- You can manually assign points to an applicant's cover letter based on your own evaluation. 
 - Points can range from 0 to 100. 
 - Or you can use the AI-generated score in previous tab to adjust the points if needed.
recruitmentCoverLettersPoints.using_desc:
- The system provides a suggested score for each cover letter based on its analysis. 
 - This score might not be accurate, but it can help you get started.

recruitmentAdnationalPoints.title: Guide for Additional Points
recruitmentAdnationalPoints.assigning_desc:
- This section allows you to manually assign additional points to applicants. 
 - Points can range from 0 to 100, contributing up to **20% of the final recruitment score**. 
 - Use your own judgment to reward applicants for qualities not covered by predefined evaluation metrics.

recruitmentCvRanking.title: Guide for CV Ranking
recruitmentCvRanking.understanding_desc:
- The CV score determines the applicant's overall score based on their CV. 
 - The CV score is calculated using a formula that takes into account the applicant's CV content. 
 - The CV score is a percentage value between 0 and 100, with a higher score indicating a better CV.

recruitmentFinalRanking.title: Guide for Final Ranking
recruitmentFinalRanking.understanding_desc:
- The final ranking determines the best applicants based on various score components. 
 - Each main factor (CV, Cover Letter, Tasks, Meetings) contributes 25% to the final score. 
 - Additional Points are counted separately, with a maximum impact of 20%, but do not increase the total maximum score.
recruitmentFinalRanking.switches_desc: - The switches allow you to enable or disable the calculation of specific components in the final score.

recruitmentFinish.title: Guide for Finalizing Recruitment
recruitmentFinish.overview_desc: The Recruitment Finish section allows you to finalize the recruitment process. Before closing, make sure to export all necessary data.
recruitmentFinish.export_desc: Click the "Export Recruitment Data" button to download all recruitment-related data.
recruitmentFinish.export_tab_1_desc: Contains all applicants, including their CVs, Cover Letters, and additional points.
recruitmentFinish.export_tab_2_desc: Contains all tasks, including their points and status.
recruitmentFinish.export_tab_3_desc: Contains all meetings, including their points and status.
recruitmentFinish.export_tab_5_desc: Contains key recruitment statistics, such as total applicants, highest score, and average score.
recruitmentFinish.close: Click "Close Recruitment" to finish the process.
recruitmentFinish.close_warning: Warning: Once closed, all submitted data will be lost!
recruitmentFinish.review_desc: Provide feedback on the recruitment process by submitting an opinion and rating (0-5 stars)

recruitmentEdit.title: Guide for Editing Recruitment
recruitmentEdit.status_desc: The recruitment status can be set to Private (hidden from applicants) or Public (open for applications).
recruitmentEdit.jobDetails_desc: Define the job role (e.g., Frontend Dev SoftHouse) and title (e.g., Frontend Developer).
recruitmentEdit.education_desc: Set the weight and level for education criteria.
recruitmentEdit.experience_desc: Set the weight and level for experience criteria.
recruitmentEdit.skills_desc: Set the weight and level for skills and courses criteria.
recruitmentEdit.language_desc: Set the weight and level for language skills criteria.
recruitmentEdit.save_desc: Click the "Save Recruitment Changes" button to save the changes.

recruitmentDelete.title: Guide for Deleting Recruitment
recruitmentDelete.warning_desc: Deleting a recruitment process is permanent and cannot be undone. All associated data will be lost!!!
recruitmentDelete.process_desc:
1. Enter the recruitment name in the confirmation field. 
 2. Wait for 5 seconds to proceed. 
 3. Click "Confirm" button. 
 4. Click "Confirm Again" to finalize deletion.
recruitmentDelete.confirmation_desc: Once confirmed, the recruitment process will be removed from the system. Ensure you have exported necessary data before proceeding.

ApplyForJob.title: Guide for Applying for a Job
ApplyForJob.personalInformation_desc:
- Name: Required, max 25 characters. 
 - Surname: Required, max 25 characters. 
 - Email: Required, must be a valid format. 
 - Phone: Required, must contain 9-15 digits.
ApplyForJob.requiredDocuments_desc:
- CV: Required, must be uploaded. Only PDF files are allowed. 
 - Cover Letter: Optional but recommended.
ApplyForJob.skillsExperience_desc:
- Relevant Skills: List key skills (e.g., JavaScript, React). 
 - Work Experience: Provide job history and roles.
ApplyForJob.coursesCertifications_desc:
- Relevant Courses: List required courses (e.g., React Advanced, JavaScript Mastery). 
 - Relevant Certifications: List required certifications (e.g., React Advanced, JavaScript Mastery).
ApplyForJob.language_desc:
- Language name must be valid. 
 - Accepted levels: A1, A2, B1, B2, C1, C2.
ApplyForJob.education_desc:
- Field of Study: Required, max 40 characters. 
 - Education Level: Required, max 25 characters. 
 - Institution Name: Optional, max 100 characters.
ApplyForJob.courses_desc:
- Relevant Courses: List required courses (e.g., React Advanced, JavaScript Mastery). 
 - Relevant Certifications: List required certifications (e.g., React Advanced, JavaScript Mastery).
ApplyForJob.submission_desc:
- Ensure all required fields are filled. 
 - Review your application before submission. 
 - You can't edit your application after submission. 
 - You can only withdraw your application after submission.

recruitmentList.title: Guide for Recruitment List
recruitmentList.overview_desc:
- The Recruitment List section displays all public and open recruitment processes available for application. 
 - You can browse available job openings and apply directly.
recruitmentList.search_desc:
- Use the search bar to find a specific recruitment by entering keywords (e.g., 'Frontend Developer'). 
 - Search results update dynamically as you type.
recruitmentList.apply_desc: - Click on a recruitment listing to view details.
recruitmentList.apply_desc_2: - Submit your CV and cover letter to apply.

SignIn.title: Guide for Signing In
SignIn.password_desc_2: - If you forgot your password, click Forgot Password? to reset it.
SignIn.google_desc: - Click on the Google Sign-In button.
SignIn.google_desc_2: - Authenticate using your Google account credentials.

SignUp.title: Guide for Signing Up
SignUp.email_desc_2: - You need to confirm your email by re-entering it.
SignUp.password_desc: - Must be at least 8 characters long.
SignUp.password_desc_2: - Use uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols.
SignUp.password_desc_3: - Confirm your password to avoid mistakes.
SignUp.terms_desc: - Accept the terms and conditions to create an account.
SignUp.google_desc: - Click on the Google Sign-Up button.
SignUp.google_desc_2: - Authenticate using your Google account credentials.

HomePage.title: Help: Managing Your Account
HomePage.email_verification_desc:
- Your email must be verified to access all features. 
 - If not verified, check your inbox for a verification link.
HomePage.update_name_desc:
- You can update your name anytime. 
 - Enter your new name and save changes.
HomePage.delete_account_desc:
- Deleting your account is permanent. 
 - All your recruitment data will be lost. 
 - To confirm, enter your username and proceed.
HomePage.update_password_desc:
- You can update your password anytime. 
 - Enter your new password and save changes.

Statistics.title: Help: Understanding Statistics
Statistics.total_recruitments_desc:
- The number of recruitments you ever created. 
 - This counts all job postings in the system, including those that have been deleted.
Statistics.total_hired_applicants_desc: - The number of applicants successfully hired through the system.
Statistics.total_meetings_desc: - The number of scheduled recruitment meetings or interviews.
Statistics.total_applications_desc: - The total number of submitted applications in the system.
Statistics.total_applications_rejected_desc: - The number of times when you were rejected from the recruitment process.
Statistics.total_applications_hired_desc: - The number of times when you were hired in the recruitment process.

MeetingsCalendar.title: Help: Managing Meetings Calendar
MeetingsCalendar.meetingsCalendar_desc:
- Displays a calendar with dots marking days that have scheduled meetings. 
 - Red dots indicate meetings from recruitment. 
 - Blue dots indicate meetings from applcations. 
 - Purple dots indicate meetings from both in single day. 
 - Click on a date to view the list of scheduled meetings for that day.
MeetingsCalendar.meetingsDetails_desc: - Shows the list of meetings scheduled for the selected date.
MeetingsCalendar.meetingsDetails_desc_6: Documents: CV Preview | Cover Letter Preview
MeetingsCalendar.meetingsActions_desc: Join Meeting: Redirects to the meeting session.
MeetingsCalendar.meetingsActions_desc_2: Open CV: Opens the applicant's CV in a new tab.
MeetingsCalendar.meetingsActions_desc_3: Open Cover Letter: Opens the applicant's cover letter in a new tab (if uploaded).

Recruitments.title: Help: Managing Recruitments
Recruitments.list of recruitments_desc:
View and manage your recruitments 
 - Filter by searching key words. 
 - Click "Manage", to go to the recruitment dashboard.

recruitmentStages.paused: Recruitment process has been paused, no further actions are being taken at this stage.
recruitmentStages.collectingApplicants: Recruitment is actively gathering applications from potential candidates.
recruitmentStages.checkingApplications: Recruitment is reviewing and evaluating the submitted applications for qualifications and fit.
recruitmentStages.interviewingApplicants: Recruitment is conducting interviews with selected candidates to assess their suitability.
recruitmentStages.scoringTasks: Recruitment is assessing and scoring candidates based on their performance in assigned tasks.
recruitmentStages.offeringJobs: Recruitment is in the process of offering jobs to selected candidates.
recruitmentStages.finished: The recruitment process has been completed, and no further actions will be taken.
